Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that has enough water and looks healthy, with features like green leaves and sturdy stems.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough water and looks unhealthy, showing wilted or brown leaves and drooping stems.
The student can show in their drawing the differences between a healthy plant with adequate water and an unhealthy plant lacking water, indicating the necessity of water for plant health.
The student may attempt to demonstrate that both animals and plants need water, possibly including a small animal or a simple source of water in the drawing.
CANNOT: The student might not clearly or consistently illustrate a pattern of multiple plants needing water (may only show a single healthy and unhealthy plant without repetition).

The student may not fully or clearly demonstrate the concept that animals need water in the same manner as plants, possibly omitting animals or misrepresenting their need for water (e.g., showing only plants).
